page.title: 11Farming in Kensworth Area
page.content: During the 1980s farming patterns have changed.Dairy farming is no longer practised here,though one or two house cows may be seen.Beef cattle,sheep, pigs and poultry are few in number. Farmers have become retailers as well as producers with the growth of farm shops.Horses play a large part in the rural scene with local stables providing riding & livery facilities. Scurry ponies & four in hand carriage driving enthusiasts travel the lanes. Cereal farming is the major type of farming now with wheat,barley,oats, oilseed rape,and some potatoes grown. Fields are larger and many hedgerows have disappeared,but wild life is catered for in areas of heath and woodland.Numbers of people engaged in agriculture are relatively few,big machines replacing them enabling increased production without drudgery.
